page.title: 10Farming - Beef
page.content: This area is not a typical agricultural one. The farms vary considerably in size from 300 acres (Hendrelas) ranging down to 5 or 10 acres. All are hill farms and some have mountain grazing rights on March Hywel Mountain, with the family working the land. On the smaller holdings, the owner or occupier will also have another job. Some farms date back over 300 years and in 1 Bryn Brych, the same family have occupied it for over 100 years. With 2 exceptions, all the farms concentrate on beef but some also rear sheep. Calves, reared from herds of cows kept for this purpose are sometimes purchased at a few weeks old from local markets. The main breeds are Welsh Black, British Freisian, Charlois, Limousin, Hereford and Simmintal.
